reviews.review_msg: Deniz is so good and he is willing to provide additional office hour to help students.

Deniz is a great professor that is super knowledgeable. His assignments are pretty tough, so make sure to ask questions during office hours. His midterm was pretty easy and VERY similar to his sample exam. However, the content after the midterm got much more difficult and the final was pretty brutal. Didn't study the textbook at all, only lectures.

Deniz was a great professor and his exams were pretty easy. Just do his practice exams and you will find most of the content on the exam on there. Pretty knowledgeable guy with a finance background in New York.

Very nice guy and receptive to feedback - can tell he genuinely cares about students' learning. 

Class is out of 110%, the extra 10% is participation 

Not the best teacher, goes off on tangents relating to theory that are not directly testable, and doesn't make that clear. 

Class is hard - not his fault, just difficult content.
Pay attention in class, study the homework and class examples and you will do fine. It's worth participating in class as you get extra marks.

He was personable and receptive to feedback, but his teaching lacked effectiveness. Lectures veered off on non‑testable theory, skipped core concepts, and frequently backtracked, muddling the message. Despite studying the text and problem sets, exam content exceeded the syllabus, and grades for assignments 2 and 3 remain unreleased.

it was his first semester teaching so there were a few kinks but was but he was committed to students learning and incorporating our feedback, the midterm was difficult but similar in comparison to other finance classes study the assignments/excel and you'll be fine, overall khalil was very caring and personable

His lectures are quite boring. He's a little unorganized. His midterm was a bit difficult, requiring a thorough understanding of the materials. Additionally, he tends to include Excel questions in both the midterm and assignments.
Jacky is very knowledgeable and responsible. Investment game project was very cool. Willing to accommodate my request for extra office hours. Definitely one of the better lectures.

The man cannot teach if his life depended on it. He rambles on incessantly about things that are irrelevant, which means that even the (painful) 4 hours of class are never enough for him to finish explaining a single chapter. He had a bunch of errors in the exam which made the questions not make sense and then just apologized when it was all over

He was a nice guy, but he couldn't explain things clearly. However, the overall course was easy as long as you have done the assignments and studied the lecture slides (the exams would be very similar with the exercises and slides). Also, Jacky would bring some finance professionals to share their success and experiences.
Great Prof, very responsible and with strong investment knowledge. Enjoyed the guest speakers a lot. Assignments are a bit too many.
This is not a Finance class, he focus on key words and his experience. He makes lots of mistake during lecture and never clarify his mistake.
He is nice, but he just can't explain things clearly. Some people said his course was easy. I had a difficult time in understanding his lecture slides and his assignments.

You will need to put in effort for this course. He may seem strict at first, but once you get to know him he is very helpful. The final/midterm used questions from tutorials so go to them, and the final was easier than the in-class midterm.
nice and friendly. final exam was easier than the midterm. This is true, use tutorial questions for study.

Good prof. I like how he explained complicated formulas and some stats concepts. The marking was fair. Take home exam is long but we had enough time. The other exams are based on the tutorial questions, so get a copy of the answers.
He is always focusing on his stocks and phd rather than this course.
Worst instructor I've ever met at SFU!!! He is not responsible at all to his students.
This prof does not give out answer keys to his assignments. making those who didn't do too well on the take home exam or assignment hard to pull up their marks later in the course.
Overall he is a great professor.  His classes are allot of work but you learn so much.  His midterms are fair, and cover the material from tutorials and the problem sets.

I was a bit afraid to take a course with him because of the reviews that say that he is hard. But he is really good. I learned A LOT! I think he is one of the best profs I've had so far. Clear lecture notes, lots of examples in tutorials, and very fair marking! We even got the full grade distribution before the final!

He's very challenging and smart and we learn a lot, but he could do more to help facilitate our learning. my main complaint is that he NEVER posts assignments ON TIME! So annoying. he posts them 3 or 4 days after he says he would, giving us little time as if we have no life but his class. In class midterm was very reasonable.

Yes, he is good at explaining the material but expects WAYYY too much from us. Take home midterm was wayy too long and time consuming. Always late for class and office hours. Doesn't offer enough help either. Overall a HORRIBLE prof.
This class is insane! Material is far too intense for 300-level class. Take-Home Midterm extremely long.. Always late, assumes students' understand everything. High expectations. Not happy right now.

Jorge does not give out examples in his lectures. All he does is ramble on about lame jokes. Tutorial questions were useful. His demand from his students was ridiculous. He was teaching far ahead of himself without teaching the foundation to his students first. He favors students and that's probably why he has good reviews on here.

I took 316 with another prof and dropped out of 315 before taking it with him, and I think that he is one of the best finance instructors at SFU. He loves finance and teaching, and his grading is fair. however, he should have two lectures every week instead of one long lecture, and more office hours, that would be easier for students.

he is a good prof. the material is dificult but he explains it very well. I spent a lot of time in office hours and he was always nice and helpful. The guy that says that he gives no examples is wrong! all we did in tutorials was examples, and we got copies of the answers. the exams/assignments are based on tutorial questions, so go to tutorials!

I'm surprised to see that so many people think he's a good prof. He's the worst I've had. He's very cocky, doesn't answer your questions unless he actually likes you as a student, and the questions he gives out as assig/exams are 400 level finance questions. He doesn't give any examples and doesn't teach you how to do questions. I hate him!

I took 315 & 316 with him in the same semester. Demanding coursework, difficult material, but the prof is extremely helpful. Will help you outside of office hours. Sense of humour and charisma, making a boring course actually interesting. No regrets taking both courses with him, but taking them separately is recommended. Favourite Prof of all time!

Very Hard Prof. Really pushes you, lots and lots of work compared to other profs. Course Requires a lot of time. You do learn a lot and he will help you if you ask but very time consuming. Do NOT take 315 and 316 together with him, it will kill you. If you plan on going into finance its not a bad idea to take the class with him espessially 316.

He has key points which are reflected through the assignments and the take-home midterm. Seems he is pretty smart and enjoys playing in the finance world, but this will be difficult to our beginners. Hope his teaching helps our future finance courses.
